description: WEDNESDAY, JULY 4, 1979

title: Students in AntiU.S. Protest
description: ACCRA, Ghana, July 3 (Reuters) Ghana University students pulled down the American flag at the United States Embassy today and tore it up to protest what they called interference in Ghana's internal affairs.

title: A Devastated Nicaragua Faces Years of Rebuilding
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, July 3 - Two weeks of heavy fighting in eastern Managua has left Nicaragua's main industrial zone in ruins. Looters have emptied most stores and offices in the capital and the country's vital export crops have been damaged.

title: Dodgers Take Over Last Place
description: SAN DIEGO, July 3 (UPI)  Gene Tenace snapped a sixthinning tie with a runscoring single and Gaylord Perry scattered nine hits tonight as the San Diego Padres posted a 32 victory over Los Angeles as the Dodgers dropped into last place for the first time since September 1967.

title: Heat Kills 70 in. Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, July 3 (Reuters)  At least 70 people died in a heat wave last week in which the temperature reached 118 degrees in the provinces of Sind and Punjab, it was reported today.

title: China Reports Testing a Missile
description: HONG KONG, July 3 (AP) -China has successfully tested a ballistic missile, the Peking radio reported. The missile, the radio said, . soared into the sky like a fire dragon and hit its target several thousand kilometers away. A transcript of the report, broadcast over Radio Pe- king's home service on June 19, was re- ceived in Hong Kong today.

title: Asarco to Close Smelter
description: EAST HELENA, Mont., July 3 (Reuters)  Asarco Inc. said today that it would shut its lead smelter here during August because of a shortage of raw materials. The plant had already been operating on a reduced fiveday week because of a shortage of lead concentrates, Asarco said.

description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, July 3,1979

title: White House Takes North Korea Criticism Calmly
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - The Carter Administration took a calm view today of North Korea's initial negative commentary on the President's visit to South Korea, noting that an editorial in Pyongyang's Communist Party newspaper avoided specifically addressing Mr. Carter's proposal for threenation talks.

title: J. Irving Crump Dies; Author and ExEditor Of Boy's Life Was 92
description: J. Irving Crump, author and editor, died yesterday in Hackensack (N.J.) Hospital after a short illness. He was 92 years old.

title: The City
description: Police Freeing 430 for Patrols

title: U.S. Wary On Way to Foil OPEC
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  The Carter Administration has concluded that there is no simple and speedy way that the United States, acting alone or in unison with other industrialized countries, can challenge the power of the oil producers cartel, Government officials said today.

title: Ghana May End Summary Executions
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 3 - The recent executions in Ghana have brought international protests, apparently forcing the new military Government to renounce further use of capital punishment in its drive to end corruption.

description: Yestarday's Weathor at 1 P M National ? and Atmospheric Administration/UPI

title: Minorities Opposing Senate Move For Abolition of Electoral College
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - The recurrent effort to abolish the Electoral College and substitute direct popular election of the President and Vice President will reach another decisive phase in the Senate when Congress returns next week from its Fourth of July holiday.

title: Topics
description: In Tokyo, the leaders of the West, meeting to discuss the oil shortage, found it necessary to drive to the emperor's palace in a motorcade of 124 automobiles. Good sense was out- raged, but the point isn't just that prime ministers get all the gas they want while the rest of us wait in line. Nor is it that people's habits are unbreakable. It's that the present threat to global patterns of consumption is largely a threat to waste. Abandon profligacy and things will look up.

title: Rhodesia's Bush War: An Aerial Closeup
description: GRAND REEF AIR BASE, Zimbabwe Rhodesia - As they darted from tree to tree, paused, then scanned the sky swiftly before dashing on again, the two young black women looked as though they were playing a children's game.

title: Nissan to Increase Exports to U.S.
description: TOKYO, July 3 (AP)  The presi'dent of Japan's Nissan Motor Company, maker of Datsun cars, said today that its export shipments to the United States would increase in fiscal 1979 because of a growing demand for fuelefficient cars.

title: In Poor Lands, Oil Price Increases Shock Economies and Erode Hopes
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - The latest OPEC oil price increases have dealt blow to aspirations of the world's poorest nations and can be expected to increase inflation, retard growth and strain political systems, according to United States officials and international development experts.

description: GREENFIELDHarry. Park Avenue Synagogue records with sorrow the passing of its loyal and devoted member and expresses deepest sympathy to the bereaved family.

title: Five Somoza Officers, All in Costa Rica, Say They Back Sandinists
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, July 3 - Five officers of Nicaragua's National Guard today declared their support of the Sandinist rebels and their hostility toward President Anastasio Somoza Debavle. their former commander.

title: Around the Nation
description: ASHDOWN, Ark., July 3 (AP) - Two small airplanes collided in flight over Millwood Lake in southwest Arkansas tonight and fell into the lake, killing at least five persons, the police said.

title: U.S. Surgical Purchase
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 3 (Reuters)  The United States Surgical Corporation said today .that it had acquired control of Merlin Medical S.A. of France for an undisclosed amount of cash and notes. It said that the acquisition was subject to approval by the French Government.

title: Ernes., Meili, a Former Executive With J. Henry Schroder, Bankers
description: Ernest H. Meili, a former vice chairman of the J. Henry Schroder Banking Corporation, died yesterday at his home in Scarsdale, N.Y. He was 77 years old.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS The Way To Rescue Britain
description: LONDON- Rebellious declarations of independence from the British Crown are the very stuff of politics: There have been two fairly fascinating ones in the present century, both of which had consequences that are very much with us today, and both of which involve Americans very closely. The first, of course, was the Irish proclamation of a Republic at Easter, 1916, and the second was the Rhodesian unilateral declaration of independence on Armistice Day, 1965. There is a deal of unfinished business arising from each.

title: Back Home From China
description: People say: You've been in China for 34 years. How do we look to you now? Dirty or clean? Weird or wise? Hopeful or deadbeat?

description: With some fanfare, Mayor Koch announced on his fourth day in office that he was cutting down on the assignment of cars to New York City officials.

description: WHEN the days grow hot, I move to my summer place, more a cabin than a house, on Gardiners Bay at the eastern end of Long Island. It is my seasonal tradeoff: I pay for the expansive view placid water and deep sky by accepting the burden of a kitchen so constricting that it is difficult to wash dishes in it, let alone cook.

title: Acme Markets Unit In New York Closing
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 2 (AP) Acme Markets Inc. said that it would close its New York division, including 45 of the division's 50 retail food stores and its division office in Syracuse, because of a widening operating deficit.

title: About Real Estate
description: The small service companies that inhabit the 1927 edifice at 101 Park Avenue have been scattering in recent months, in advance of the scheduled demolition of the building and its neighbor, 103 Park Avenue. H. J. Kalikow & Company expects to put up a 1.1million-square-foot office building there.

title: Iran Sets Prices For Oil Contracts
description: TEHERAN, Iran, July 3 (AP) Iran has set contract prices of $19.70 to $19.90 per barrel of heavy crude oil and $21 to $22 for light crude following'last month's pricefixing meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, the National Iranian Oil Company said today.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: ITALKED at some length recently about the appeal of foods that had been stuffed - anything from vegetables and loins of meat to seafood. It was pointed out that the cooking of most stuffed dishes fairly extended and hard to do in an hour or less. One of the great, easily made and hastily cooked dishes is stuffed sole fillets.

title: Nuclear Waste Dump in Nevada Is Shut as Truck Leak Is Found
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., July 3 (AP) Gov. Robert List, saying he was fed up with the dangers involved, has ordered the closing of a nuclear waste dump near Beatty after a truck carrying radioactive waste to the site sprang a leak.

title: Citicorp Note Rate Up
description: Citicorp reported that the average rate in its weekly auction of 90day notes rose yesterday to 9.906 percent from 9.838 percent last week. Bids accepted ranged from 9.83 percent to 9.93 percent, and the bank holding company accepted $100 million of the $671 million of bids submitted. Next week, Citicorp will sell $150 million of 91day notes.

title: Truck Traffic Increases As Protest Seems to Ebb
description: several more states reported truck traffic back on the roads yesterday, and the Interstate Commerce Commission said that rank-and-file independent truckers were ignoring appeals by their leaders to prolong their threeweek nationwide protest.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: DETROIT, July 3 The Ford Motor Company announced today that it was raising the price of most of its 1979 models by an average 1.2 percent, or about $89 each, as of Thursday.

title: Cuomo Reports an Offer to Aid Carter Race
description: Lieut. Gov. Mario M. Cuomo yesterday said he had been asked to take a lead role in running President Carter's reelection campaign'in New York State.

title: Scholar Solves Case of the Talmudic Fragments
description: DR. ABRAHAM I. KATSH is an American Hebrew scholar, detective, you might call him, who has just closed the case of the Talmud fragments, a case he worked on for 17 years that sheds new light from ancient sources.

title: Improved Gas Supply Is Expected for Area Today
description: Motorists will find more gasoline stations in the metropolitan New York area open today, Independence Day, than last weekend, and fuel supplies somewhat more abundant, according to automobile club spokesmen.

title: Inquiry Pressed on Altman's Fire
description: Fire marshals continued yesterday to sift through the rubble of Monday's fire at B. Altman & Conipany, but declined to suggest a cause. One theory they are investigating is that a lighted cigarette tossed into a plastic pail may have started the fire. The pail was discovered melted down among the charred debris in the secondfloor storeroom.

title: Democracy Climbs the Andes Again
description: Bolivia's second national election in a year was good deal more convincing than the first. The balloting last July was marked by widespread fraud, leading first to an annulment of the result and then to two militam COUDS. This week's contest was generally recog- nized as the freest in a very long time and snouia produce Bolivia's first popularly elected president in decade. He will be chosen by the newly elected Congress next month from among this week's top three finishers, all former presidents.

title: Judge Upholds City's Agreement For Integration of Teaching Staff
description: Judge Jack B. Weinstein yesterday upheld the legality of a voluntary agreement between the New York City Board of Education and the Federal Office for Civil Rights to begin integrating the teaching staffs in the city's publicschool system by this fall.

title: Court Turnabout: Curbing Access to Trials
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - The Supreme Court decision giving trial judges nearly unlimited discretion to close their courtrooms whenever the defense and the prosecution agree is much more than another controversial press case. It is

title: Dayan to Visit Netherlands
description: JERUSALEM, July 3 (Reuters) - For- eign Minister Moshe Dayan, who had a cancerous polyp removed from his lower intestine last week, left the hospital yes- terday and will visit the Netherlands July 16 as planned, his office said today.

title: Shanghai jail Holds Fewer Reactionaries
description: SHANGHAI, June 30 - In the Shanghai Municipal Prison, a forbidding sootstained complex of bulky concrete buildings, the number of political prisoners has fallen sharply in recent years, according to the prison's chief political commissar.

title: Officer Loses an Eye In Harlem Shootout
description: A police sergeant, his face lacerated and one eye destroyed by a shotgun blast from an automobile, emptied his service revolver at the suspects before his partner carried him tack to the patrol car. Later, one of four men who fled the scene was picked up bleeding from a leg wound.

title: Jenkins's OneHitter Stymies Orioles, 40
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., July 3 (UPI) Ferguson Jenkins fired a onehitter, and Jim Sundberg drove in two runs with a secondinning double to lead the Texas Rangers to a 40 victory over the Baltimore Orioles tonight.

title: No Article -- Title
description: CUBS BEAT THE EXPOS: Rodney Scott of the Expos fired ball to first base to catch Mike Vail of the Cubs for a double play after forcing Jerry Martin at second base during the second inning yesterday at Chicago. Cubs won the game, 32.

title: Rising Medical Use of XRays Stirs Concern Over LongRange Hazard;
description: Americans have been exposed to in- creasing amounts of radiation in medical and dental practice over recent years in what has become this country's greatest single source of manmade, lowlevel radiation.

description: Outgoing

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Bond prices drifted lower yesterday as the credit markets quieted down before the Fourth of July holiday. Bond dealers and investors seemed to be marking time, waiting for the statistics on money supply, employment, whole.. sale prices and consumer credit scheduled to be released later this week.

title: A Glorious Menu From the New York City of 150 Years Ago
description: One hundred and fifty years ago, a time when Revolutionary War veterans still marched in parades, the celebration of Independence Day was an exuberant, uninhibited Glorious Saturnalia to be commemorated with military pomp, lengthy orations, spectacular displays of fireworks and an orgy of eating and drinking.

title: Mortgage Rates Climbed in June
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (AP) Home mortgage rates rose in June by the largest amount for any month this year, the Government reported today,

title: Global Marine Gas Find
description: LOS ANGELES, July 2 (UPI) Global Marino Inc. confirmed that commercial gas discovery had been made in the High Island area of the Gulf of Mexico off the Texas coast, Global Marine has a 42.3 percent interest in the tract. Mesa Petroleum, the operator, has a half Interest.

description: EDELSONSaul. Loving husband of Emma. Beloved father of Gilbert and Edward. Cherished grandfather of Martha, Paula, Dorothy, Noah, Daniel and Anne. Services 10am Thursday,Boulevard Park West Chapel 115 W 79 St, NYC.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Stephen A. Barrow, the new chairman of the South. Bronx Overall Econoinic Development Corporation, calls the area geographically perfect for industrial development. He points out: It has both waterways and highways and is near two major airports In addition, it has a huge untapped abor force.

title: Aides Sentenced in Crdit Suisse Case
description: GENEVA, July 3  Ernst Kuhrmeler, at one time a leading manager of Credit Suisse, was convicted today of having involved the bank in the biggest scandal in Swiss banking history. He was sentenced to four and a half years in prison and fined $6,000.

title: 16 Scripts Chosen For O'Neill Center
description: The scripts of 16 playwrights were chosen from 1,300 submitted by playwrights in 46 states for the annual Eugene O'Neill Theater Center's Playwrights Conference and the New Drama Television project that will be held from Sunday through Aug. 5 at the center's headquarters in Waterford, Conn.

title: City Workers in Toledo Return Under Court Order
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, July 3 - Most of the city's 3,400 striking municipal workers returned to work under a court order today, but the city was far from operating normally. Some municipal unions accepted the city administration's latest contract offer, but it was rejected by rank-and-file police officers.

title: Entertainment Events
description: GUGGENHEIM CONCERT: GOLDMAN BAND, Damrosch Park, Uncoin Center, 8.

title: Bonn's Governing Party. Criticizes Strauss Nomination for Chancellor
description: BONN, July 3 - The nomination .of Franz Josef Strauss, the- conservative West German leader, as the opposition candidate for chancellor in the 1980 elections was denounced today by the governing Social Democratic Party as possible menace to the nation's political system. The nomination also drew criticism from within opposition ranks.

title: 37 Summonses Issued On Dumping Violations
description: Thirtyseven summonses for illegal dumping were issued by the Sanitation Department from May 30 to June 23, according to an announcement by Frank J. Sisto, Acting Commissioner. Violators face fines of up to $250 for each offense.

title: Increase in Steel Capacity Urged
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)  The domestic steel industry must expand its capacity by about 12 percent by 1990 to meet United States demand, even though the growth rate in consumption is expected to slow through the 1980's, according to a Commerce Department study.

title: Jakarta to Lift Output of Oil
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, July 3 (AP) Indonesia plans to increase crude oil production from 582 million barrels in 197980 to 668 million barrels in 198384 to meet increasing domestic demand and keep up exports, Pertamina's presidentdirector, Piet Haryono, has announced.

title: California Panel Delays Decision On Action Against Chief Justice
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 3  The question of whether to proceed against Chief Justice Rose Bird with a possible contempt citation has been put off until Thursday, Bertram D. Janes, chairman of the State Commission on Judicial Performance, announced today.

title: Ballet: Nureyev With the Canadians
description: THE NATIONAL BALLET OF CANADA returned to New York last night with Rudolf Nureyev, the first time since 1976 that Mr. Nureyev has appeared with the company from Toronto. In 1973, his drawing power as a guest artist enabled the troupe to make its local debut in an operahouse setting and with a fullevening operahouse ballet.

title: NATAN G. RAKHLIN
description: MOSCOW July 3 (UPI) - The Soviet press today reported the death of Natan G. Rakhlin, former conductor of the Kharkov Radio Symphony Orchestra, the Ukrainian Symphony and the U.S.S.R. State Symphony. He was 74 years old.

title: Carey Ponders Maternity Rights for Public Employees
description: ALBANY,July 3 - Governor Carey's administration is split over a measure that would require both state and local governments to give maternity benefits to employees, their spouses and their depndents.

title: Charges Dropped Against 709
description: EXETER, N.H., July 3 (AP) Charges against 709 of the 1,414 protest. ers arrested in a 1977 protest at the Seabrook nuclear plant site have been dropped. The decision was made because of the declining social significance of these cases against the continuing inconvenience and expense to this county, the. Rockingham County Attorney, Carlton Eldredge, said.

title: Bolivian Military Warned on Coup
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 3 - Gen. Hugo Banzer Suarez, a rightwing nationalist candidate for President, cautioned Bolivia's military rulers today against any hasty reaction to Sunday's elections, suggesting that they await the final results.

title: TV: In Letters to CBS, Viewers Become Critics
description: IN theory; Letters to CBS News is admirable. Viewers are given a rare forum to comment on, perhaps even squawk about, what they see on network news programs. A standard and useful feature of the print press  Letters to the Editor  is being dressed in electronic garb.

title: Coney Beaches Stay Open As Wind Drives Oil to Sea
description: An oil slick that had been threatening the Coney Island shore was blown out to sea early yesterday and parks officials announced that the beach area would be open for today's holiday.

title: Judge Acquits Citibank of Charge
description: Federal Judge Robert W. Warren, in a ruling in United States District Court in Milwaukee, said that there was no evidence to show that Citibank had provided Paccar Inc., a truck company, with inside information about the Harnischfeger Corporation in preparation for Paccar's proposed takeover of the heavy equipment producer.

title: Carter to Visit Three Cities
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (UPI)  President Carter plans to visit at least three United States, cities this month. On Saturday, he will fly to Louisville, Ky., for a meeting of the National Governors Association. On July 16, he will fly to Kansas City, Mo., to speak to a meeting of the National Association of Counties. I Later that day he will fly to Detroit to speak to the convention of the Communications Workers of America.

title: Jersey Parkway Hit by Walkout Of Toll Takers
description: TRENTON, July 3 - Toll collectors and maintenance workers went on strike on the Garden State Parkway this afternoon in a dispute over a pay raise, but the 173mile toll road a major route to New Jersey shore resorts - remained open as supervisors and administrators manned the tollbooths.

title: Pact on Moon's Riches Approved
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 3 After seven years labor, an international treaty on the exploitation of the moon's resources was approved by the 47-member Committee on Outer Snace today.

title: Bonn Parliament Vote Abolishes Time Limit On WarCrime Cases
description: BONN, July 3 - With arguments that West Germany's responsibility before history was at stake, a majority in the lower house of Parliament overcame strong opposition today and voted to continue the prosecution of war criminals of the Nazi era.

title: Pyotr Y. Antropov Dies; Soviet Uranium Leader
description: Pyotr Y. Antropov, a Soviet geologist who has now been identified as manager of the secret uranium industry, died June 23 in Moscow. He was 73 years old.

title: Reggie Jackson Is Honored
description: On the eve of the 40th anniversary of Lou Gehrig's farewell speech Yankee Stadium, Reggie Jackson was honored before last night's game the Stadium by the National ALS Foundation, the organization that seeks to find a cause and cure for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, the disease which Gehrig died two years after his speech of July 4,1939.

title: Blast Kills 2
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 3 (AP) Illegal fireworks were the suspected cause of a series of explosions and a fire today that killed two persons, injured five others and destroyed three houses, the authorities said.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Will Fight Amendment to Curb Busing
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People yesterday announced the start of a nationwide campaign to defeat a proposed constitutional amendment prohibiting the busing of students beyond their neighborhood schools.

title: Carter's Envoy Arrives in Egypt
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, July 3  Robert S. Strauss, President Carter's special representative for Middle East peace talks, flew over the West Bank of the Jordan by Israeli helicopter today and then flew here to confer with President Anwar elSadat.

title: MurderTrial Hearsay Upheld
description: The victim, a 72-year-old woman, was dying, an icepick protruding from her chest. Her brother, who had just arrived at her Manhattan apartment,'asked: What is the matter? As she was dying, according to trial testimony, she replied: Eddie will kill you.

title: Gas: Perception and Reality
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - Like California the month before, the New York metropolitan area was taken by surprise in June when the gassupply crisis struck, creating long lines at service stations,

title: News of the Theater
description: IF all goes according to plan, Peter Ustinov will make his debut as King Lear next winter in New York. This plan  conceived on the drawing board of Alexander H. Cohen, the producer  calls for Mr. Ustinov to arrive here after a tryout excursion that will start in Canada: He will first play. Lear in October at the Stratford Festival in Ontario and then make stops in Boston, Washington and Chicago before opening on Broadway soon after Christmas.

title: VIRGINIA SINCLAIR M'DIVANI
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., July 3 (UPI) Virginia Sinclair M'divanl, daughter of Harry Sinclair, the oil tycoon, died at St. John's Hospital Sunday after a long illness. She was 64 years old.

title: A. Clarke Bedford, 88, Had Been An Executive of Jersey Standard
description: A. Clarke Bedford, former executive vice president of the Esso Standard Oil Company, an East Coast operating affiliate of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died Sunday at his home in Hightstown, N.J. He was 88 years old and lived in the Meadow Lakes Retirement Community.

title: Marine Gen. Reginald H. Ridgely; World War II Japanese Prisoner
description: Lieut. Gen. Reginald H. Ridgely, retired, of the Marine Corps, who survived nearly four years in Japanese prison camps in World War H and later became commanding general of Camp Pendleton, Calif., died last Thursday at Kilmarnock, Va. He was 76 years old.

title: Economic Scene
description: The world's dangerous dependence upon fuel from the Middle East has a striking parallel in the realm of food. Today most of the globe is as hooked on Wheat from the United States as on oil from OPEC, and the habit has been growing rapidly in the last few years deSpite efforts by most nations to become more selfsufficient.

title: Why Not Draft the Next Congress?
description: BLACKSBURG, Va. - The AllVolunteer Congress has proved to be a failure. Its cost is extremely high and there is not a proportional representation of minorities. There are also many doubts about the honesty and intelligence of the recent volunteers. Many of Congress's recent failures are owing to the low quality of its composition.

title: No Gas Limits, Never a Line, Always Open
description: HILLSBORO, N.H.. July 3 (AP) -Picture a 24hour gasoline station with no lines, no limits, plenty of g,as and no attendant to check the last digit on your license plate.

title: ABC to Make Cable and Disk Shows
description: The American Broadcasting Companies yesterday created a division to develop and market programming for the burgeoning technologies of cabletelevision, video disks and home video recorders.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, JULY 3, 1070

title: Ten Finish Mile in Under 3:59
description: STOCKHOLM, July 3 (AP) - Steve Scott of the United States passed Eamon Coghlan with about 50 yards left and won the feature mile at an ternational track and field meet tonight. The first 10 finishers in the man field were timed in under 3 minutes 59 seconds.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: Article 3 -- No Title

title: Arizona, Pressed by Atom Panel, Moves to Shut Plantl
description: TUCSON, Ariz., July 1 - Arizona's Atomic Energy Commission, under pressure from Federal regulators whose recommendations it at first ignored, is moving to shut permanently a manufacturing plant that has contaminated a school kitchen, an old people's center and other parts of its neighborhood with radioactive material.

title: Increasing the Catch On American Tables
description: ABOARD S.S. SURVEYOR, off Alaska - The average American eats only, one pound of fish a month, as against about four pounds of poultry and 19 pounds of meat. Twothirds of the fish consumed is imported, which, Richard Frank observes, has some doleful implications.

title: U.N. Agency Allocates $1 Million To Assist Nicaraguan Refugees
description: GENEVA, July 3The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees has allotted over $1 million in emergency funds to assist Nicaraguans who have fled the civil war in their country, it was announced here today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream U.S. Unhappy With Wildlife Treaty
description: As anticipated, the United States came away from a twoweek international convention on wildlife conservation in Bonn, West Germany, without agreeing to the treaty proposed.

title: For Reggie Jackson, the Crowds Are Always There, Even Outside the Stadium
description: Nobody in New York likes me, Reginald M. Jackson said in one of his more seething moments last week.

title: A Cruise Continues For U.S. Swimmers
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., July 3 (AP) Cynthia Woodhead broke her world record in the 200meter freestyle and Tami Paumier upset Tracy Caulkins in the 100meter breaststroke as the United States continued to dominate the swimming competition at the Pan American Games tonight.

title: Carters at Camp David
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., July 3 (AP) President and Mrs. Carter today flew by helicopter to this Presidential retreat and planned to stay at least through tomorrow. The President will put the finishing touches on an energy address to the nation scheduled for 9 P.M. Thursday. Ile will deliver the broadcast speech from the White House.

title: Careers
description: CHAMPION athletes, such as Dorothy Hamill, the figure skater, have become a growing business for a new type of expert, the kinesiologist.

title: NEW BID BY CARTER ON RATIONING LIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - President Carter sees his energy speech Thursday night as his best opportunity yet to rally the nation behind an energy program that will rescue the United States from overdependence on foreign oil, White House officials said today. He intends to sketch out the directions in which he plans to move, - rather than to present detailed proPosals.

title: Little ThankYou's Rebuffed by Post Office
description: The United States Postal Service is not out to sabotage etiquette, but etiquette was apparently on its way sabotaging the post office. Those little informal cards, beloved by generations of traditionalists, will be out, as of July 15, unless delivered by hand or pigeon. Put one in the mail after the cutoff date, and it's going to make a round trip right back you.

title: HOLIDAY GAS SEARCH LIKELY TO BE EASIER FOR AREAS DRIVERS
description: Motorists appeared likely to find gaso. line easier to get on this midweek holiday than on the last two frustrating weekends in metropolitan New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Governors of the three states sought more supplies yesterday under new interpretations of Federal rules.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: Sonnenberg Mansion Sold for  $1.5 Million
description: The sale of the 37room Benjamin Sonnenberg town house at 19 Gramercy Park, often called the finest private house in New York City, was concluded yesterday.

title: Notes From the Gas Line
description: A new form of greeting - There were only six cars in my gas line this morning (give or take a couple of cars) - turned up, in elevators, offices and supermarkets in and around the city yesterday.

title: Connecticut Will Buy 12 SelfPropelled Cars For Amtrak Rail Line
description: HARTFORD, July 3 - Gov. Ella T. Grasso is scheduled to announce tomorrow that Connecticut will buy 12 selfpropelled railroad cars for Amtrak to run from New Haven through Hartford to Springfield, Mass.

title: City Games Will Begin Tomorrow
description: The first Big Apple Games, co-sponsored by the city's Board of Education and the state's Division of Youth, will begin tomorrow at eight high schools in the five boroughs.

title: Independent Town Is Ready for Independence Day
description: DU PONT, Wash. - The Fourth of July is special to this former company town of fewer than 400 people on Puget Sound. Here, in 1891, an American naval officer, Capt. Charles Wilkes, is said to have celebrated the first Independence Day west of the Missouri.

title: Some Picnic Hamper Favorites for a Banquet Alfresco
description: Ruth Adams Brenes Barbecued Spareribs Or Chicken

title: Needless Vaccination Now Held Sole Cause of Death by Smallpox
description: The dread smallpox virus has probably been eliminated from nature everywhere on earth, but fear of smallpox is still causing death and illness through unnecessary use of vaccine to prevent the disease.

title: The Region
description: Rate Increase Won By Utility in Jersey

title: World News Briefs
description: MEXICO CITY, July 3 (UPI) - The ruling Revolutionary Institutional Party reported today that it had won 281 of 300 congressional races in Sunday's election, and the Mexican Communist Party reported it had received enough votes to qualify to be on the 1982 presidential ballot. Official results will not be in until next week.

title: Store Owner Is Killed in Harlem
description: The owner of a Harlem record shop was killed yesterday by a gunman who walked into the shop, shot him in the face and chest and fled. the police said The victim was Identified as Robert Brown, 69 years old, owner of the record store at 2803 Eighth Avenue. The police said robbery did not appear to be a motive In the slaying.

title: U.S. Study Says Cuba Plays Cautious Role in Nicaragua
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 - A recent United States intelligence analysis repoits.steppedup Cuban aid to the Sandinist guerrillas in Nicaragua but also says Havana's policy is cautious and designed to avoid direct Cuban military participation and the risk of confrontation with Washington.

title: Venezuelan Oil Find
description: CARACAS, Venezuela (UPI)  The Venezuelan state oil monopoly, Petrleos de Venezuela S.A., today announced an important discovery of mediumgrade crude oil in the western state of Zulla. Initial tests show a daily production of approxi mately 5,000 barrels daily of mediumgrade crude, the company said.

title: Bridge:
description: Beginners who learn holdup plays and ducking plays often become intoxicated with such concepts and overdo their application, surrendering tricks at the wrong time. Eventually some suffering partner explains that they should not refuse a trick unless they know exactly why they are doing it.

title: Dan White Gets 7 Years 8 Months In Double Slaying in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 3 - Former Supervisor Dan White, who was convicted of manslaughter in May in the killings of Mayor George Moscone and Supervisor Harvey Milk, was sentenced today to a maximum sentence of seven years and eight months in prison.

title: Mexican Oil Financing
description: TOKYO, July 2 (UPI)  The vice president of the Mexican oil corporation, Ignacio de Leon, signed an agreement today for a $125 million loan with a syndicate of 16 Japanese banks to help finance Mexico's oildevelopment projects, the Bank of Tokyo said. A spokesman for the bank said that interest on the fiveyear loan was fixed at the London interbank rate plus spread of 0.625 percent per annum. He said that the loan was repayable in five years.

title: Jets Robinson Signs
description: The Jets signed Matt Robinson, the quarterback, yesterday to a threeyear contract estimated at $100,000 a season. Robinson led the team to six victories in 11 starts filling in for the injured Richard Todd. He passed for 2,002 yards and 13 touchdowns.

title: Uncle Sam Is Now 30
description: PRINCETON, N.J. - Just 15 years ago, the Berkeley Free Speech Movement told us, Don't Trust Anybody Over 30. That's a risky proposition now. According to the series II projec- tions of the Census Bureau, the median age of all Americans on July 1, 1979, was precisely 30.0. Put simply, this means that half of us are on one side of the oncedreaded generation Rubicon, half on the other. For social historians, this is as significant a demographic milestone in its own way as 1920, when for the first time more Americans lived in the cities than onthe farms.

title: East Bloc Gaining in Chemicals
description: BONNThe West European chemical industry is facing growing competition from Eastern Europe, a problem aggravated by compensation arrangements made by the Western companies in their rush to participate in the Eastern bloc's modernization drive.

title: Look Magazine Dismisses Staff And Ends Ties to Rolling Stone
description: Look magazine dismissed its art and editorial staff yesterday and announced that it was ending its association with Rolling Stone, which had been managing the magazine since May. But Look denied that it was ceasing publication.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Broad price moves marked trading in soybeans and grains yesterday, with local Chicago professionals trying to square their accounts before the Independence Day holiday and exporters rushing in to eagerly absorb the selling.

title: The Fourth Filtered Through Time
description: IT is a vision of Independence Day derived not from reality but from books and pictures. The time is nearly 60 years ago, and the war to end all wars has been fought and won.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ALL YOU CAN Mindful that the gas shortage will prevent holiday motoring out to the shore and the woods, the city's largest dance palace has added some picnic touches, mainly in the food department, to its establishment in the heart of Manhattan.

title: U.S. Easing Some Price Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  The Government today told two leading producers of synthetic fibers and chemicals, E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company and the Union Carbide Corporation, that they could raise prices in line with the more liberal of two Federal guide lines for voluntary price restraint.

title: Involving Parents in the Education of Their Retarded Children
description: LOS ANGELES, July 2 - Two years ago, the Rev. Benjamin Short and his wife, Elizabeth, a nurse, were overwhelmed by the difficulties of teaching their retarded 6-year-old daughter to master even the simplest tasks.

title: Q&A
description: QMy mother, who was from the other side, always made her chicken broth with chicken feet. It was the best stock I ever ate, and when the soup was cold, it congealed because of the gelatin in the feet My mother always skinned off the thin yellow coating of the feet, but I can't do it. Is there some special technique involved? A I have recently. started tossing a few chicken feet into the kettle when I make chicken broth, and it does, indeed, give a nice body to the stock. It also congeals when chilled. My supplier, Sal Iacono, who owns the Iacono Poultry Farm in East Hampton, instructed me as follows: Heat a kettle of water to the boil on top of the stave to a temperature of 150 degrees. Drop in the chicken feet, and bring the water back to the 150 degree temperature as quickly as possible. Let the feet stand in the water at that temperature for about minute,

title: RICHARD WARD DIES; STAGE AND TV ACTOR
description: Played in Ceremonies in Dark Old Men and Anna Lucasta Good Times Grandpa

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Milwaukee Brewers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 16Ist Street, the Bronx, 8 P.M. (Television  Channel 11, P.M. Radio WINS, 8 P.M.)

title: June Traffic For Airlines Increased
description: Passenger traffic on many of the nation's airlines was substantially higher last month than a year earlier despite the grounding of DC10's since June 6.

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 15 national television shows of the past week (Monday, June 25, to Sunday, July 1), listed according to their rank In the ratings complied by the A.C. Nielsen Company. A rating 13 a percentage of the total number of United States households with television sets.

title: Unilever in Antitrust Charges
description: COPENHAGEN, July 2 (AP)  Ten persons, including the managing director of Danish Unilever Inc., were charged today with distributing more than $10 million in illegal trade discounts to retailers in a threeyear campaign to grab a larger share of the Danish margarine market for plants controlled by Unilever.

title: Suspect in Birmingham Bombing To Appeal Order for Extradition
description: ATLANTA, July 3 (AP)  J.B. Stoner says he will appeal to the United States Supreme Court a Georgia Supreme Court decision allowing his extradition to Alabama to face explosives charges.

title: I.M.F. Gold Sells at Record
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)  The International Monetary Fund said that it sold 440,000 ounces of gold at a record average price of $281.52 an ounce in its monthly auction today.

title: ITALIAN COMMUNISTS RESUME OPPOSITION
description: ROME, July 3 - Enrico Berlinguer, the head of Italy's Communist Party,. declared today that the Communists had decided to become an opposition party again, ending support, in Parliament and outside, for the minority Government formed by the Christian Democrats.

title: Brewers Win, 72, Making Caldwell 61 Over Yankees
description: This is how bad it was for the Yankees last night: Bucky Dent was knocked out of the game by a nickel.

title: Chile Devalues Peso
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 3 (Reuters) - The Chilean peso was devalued by 5.41 pct, effective yesterday, to 39 pesos per dollar from 36.89 pesos last Friday, the Chilean central bank said today. The new rate will remain in force until Feb. 29, 1980, the bank said. The aim of the fixed rate, the first for Chile since since October 1973, is to reduce domestic inflationary expectations resulting from rising foreignexchange costs, Treasury Minister Sergio de Castro said.

title: World Gold
description: TUESDAY, JULY 3, 1979

title: Wine Talk
description: THERE is a lot of talk around these days about investing in wine. Be very cautious. The word investment can mean several things. If a wine investment means that you are insuring some good drinking for yourself, fine. Good wines do disappear and, if you know what you like, it's wise to get them while they are still available. If you are hedging against rising prices, that's O.K. too. Just remember that a lot of people bought wine at very high prices in 1972 and 1973 only to see the market collapse shortly thereafter.

title: More Saudi Oil Expected, But Reasons Are Unclear
description: Oil industry sources said yesterday that they had reason to believe that Saudi Arabia would increase oil production  possibly by enough to wipe out the present worldwide shortage of crude oil  but they differed widely as to why the Saudis would do so.

title: Harry Sylvester Lowenthal Marries Karen Gail Saffran
description: The marriage of Karen Gail Saffran, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Saffran of Woodmere, L.1., to Harry Sylvester Lowenthal, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Lowenthal of Paris, took place on

title: Deliver Lower Food Prices
description: Diesel fuel shortages and rapidly rising prices are increasing shipping costs - and thus the cost of almost everything delivered on wheels. Yet the Federal Trade Commission, that sometime champion of consumers, forcing truckers to waste hundreds of thousands of gallons of fuel each day in handling the nation's groceries.

title: The Inclusive Fourth
description: Even on a gasshort Fourth, with a siphon stuck into national confidence, there stands a continuing achievement which alone warrants all the fireworks: Americans hardly give it a thought, but ours is a multiracial democracy from which few, however desperate for political change, want out.

title: Dixieland Concert Is Set In Ft. Tryon Park July 10
description: The Sheridan Square Street Stompers Welcome to Summer, a Dixieland concert, sponsored by the West HarlemWashington Heights Senior Citizens Council, will be presented at the Fort Tryon Park playground, at Broadway and Dyckman Street in Manhattan, next Tuesday at 7 P.M. In case of rain, the event will be held the following day.

title: Uncle Tai Is Alive and Cooking in Houston
description: HOUSTON, July 3 Where is Uncle Tai? Although it was reported in The New York Times in January that Wen Dah Tai had not been in New York for six months, advertisements in New York publications insist that he is right where he had been: presiding over the kitchen of the Third Avenue restaurant that bears his name.

title: A Matisse Sets Record For Moderns at Auction
description: LONDON, July 3 (AP) - A portrait by Henri Matisse, sold in London today, set a world auction price record for a 20thcentury painting. Le Jeune Marin I (The Young Sailor) was purchased by an anonymous buyer at Christie, Manson & Woods for $1,576,800.

title: Chess:
description: For a Good Bluff, Consider An Aggressive Lion's Roar

title: Money
description: TUESDAY, JULY 3, 1979

title: Newsprint Off In Canada
description: MONTREAL, July 2 (UPI)  Canadian newsprint production fell some percent in May to 720,000 metric tons, and dropped 2 percent for the first five months of 1979 compared with the same period last year, according to a report today by the Canadian Pulp and Paper Association..

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: Lawrence Van Gelder

title: For Jamaica, Redevelopment Is a Promise Unfulfilled
description: Early last month, the White House announced its support for construction of a $92 million Social Security Administration building in downtown Jamaica, Queens, that would place 3,000 employees in the ailing business district. Almost immediately, Rodney B. Thomas, the Community Board 12 district manager, catled the announcement manna from heaven and predicted that Jamaica would ;'rise like a phoenix out of the ashes of its own decay.

title: Knight Scolded
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., July 3 - Only hours after representatives of the International Amateur Basketball Federation reprimanded Coach Bobby Knight for a temperamental outburst last night, the United States men's team crushed Cuba, 8553, tonight and remained undefeated in the Pan American Games.

title: Officials Crack Down Hard And Fast on Gas Violations
description: Moving with unusual speed, authorities charged the. operators of a Brooklyn gasoline station yesterday with shaking down a federally financed community patrol organization in exchange for filling its live neighborhood prowl cars with gas any time and any day, odd or even.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Fourth of July motorists may find gasoline easier to get today than on the last two weekends in metropolitan New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, as governors of the three states scrounged for more supplies under new interpretations of Federal rules. The governors had been told by President Carter that companies could shift supplies from surplus areas: [Page Al.]

title: Beach Nudity: Pathos in the Glare of the Sun
description: ON South Beach in Martha's Vineyard, the tide deposits stones, shells, seaweed, wood, cork and a few white plastic bottles. Sometimes it breaks down the restraining dunes that keep the water from flooding the land.

title: Korea Reportedly Picks U.S. for Reactor Contract
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 3 (AP) South Korea is preparing to order nuclear reactors from the United States to build two power plants, sources close to the deal have reported.

title: Suspect Fire Sweeps 3 Houses
description: A threealarm fire of suspicicous origin damaged three vacant threestory frame houses in the Borough Park section of Brooklyn yesterday morning, the police said. They said a derelict who had been sleeping in one building injured an elbow when he jumped from a secondfloor window to escape the flames. The fire broke out at 472212th Avenue and spread to 47.20 and 4714.

title: Bicycle Commuters Get New Spots to'Park in City
description: With interest iw bicycles booming anew as an urban option to the tyranny of the gas lines, public agencies in New York City are making it easier for potential twowheel commuters to leave their cars at home.

title: Third Victim Dies in Philadelphia In a Suspected Fireworks Blast
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 4 (AP) third person has died of injuries suffered in an explosion that injured three others and destroyed three houses yesterday.

title: 7 Bodies Recovered From a Lake After 2 Planes Crash in Arkansas
description: ASHDOWN, Ark., July 4 (AP)  The bodies of seven persons, including that of a 4-year-old girl, have been recovered from the wreckage of two light planes in lake in southwestern Arkansas.

title: 4 U.S. Crews Vying For Henley Honors
description: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, July 4  More than 1,500 oarsmen from 10 countries will begin competing tomorrow on the stretch of the River Thames here that has been the scene of the Royal regatta annually since 1839, except for the war years.

title: Beaths
description: LEVEYNathan. American Friends of Boys Town Jerusalem records with deep sorrow the passing of a good friend, Nat Levey, who was dedicated to the welfare of the students at Boys Town Jerusalem:The faculty, staff and student body in Jerusalem extend their condolences. IRA GUILDER, President RABBI ALEXANDER S. L1NCHNE R, Dean MANNY HENZEL. Executive Di-

title: Beaths
description: BAKERSusan. Suddenly on July 2. 1979. Beloved daughter of Selma and Herman Sulken. Dear sister of Richard Sul ken.. Services private.

title: Policeman Suspended on Charge Of Identifying Undercover Officer
description: A New York City policeman assigned to a special tactical unit has been suspended without pay on a charge of disclosing the Identity of an undercover policeman.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Of Debt and Taxes, Gas and Anger
description: CHESTERFIELD, Mass., July 4 Of all days to feel dependent!

title: U.S. Nine Defeats Venezuela 72
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., July 4>  The United States overcame a major hurdle to the Pan American Games gold medal in baseball today when it upset Venezuela, 72.

title: Craig Virgin Captures Peachtree Distance Run
description: ATLANTA, July 4 (AP)  Craig Virgin, who holds the national record for the 10,000meter run, won the annual Peachtree road race today. About 20,000 runners entered.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: CONTRACT MARINER (Contract Marine Carriers). Garstors July 20, Antwerp 23 and Bremen 25; sails from Port Elizabeth, N.J.

title: Carlton's OneHitter Beats Mets
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 4  Only Elliott Maddox's oneout double in the seventh inning that bounced high off the leftfield wall kept Steve Carlton, the Phillies ace southpaw, from pitching a nohit gmite tonight.

title: Rain Makes Fizzle of 4th But Not the Fireworks
description: The National Weather Service had promised a beautiful Fourth of July, but earlyafternoon showers coupled with gasoline shortages in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut kept many celebrants home and off highways.

title: Pop: Larry Adler Starts 10 Weeks at the Cookery
description: ALTHOUGH Larry Adler, the mouthorgan virtuoso who has lived in England since the early 50's, was making his first appearance in New York in tour years when he opened at the Cookery on Tuesday evening, he made no attempt to disguise where his interests lay at the moment.

title: OIL USE IN U.S. DIPS; EUROPE SHOWS RISE
description: PARIS, July 4  The United States consumed less oil during the first four months of this year than it did in the comparable period of 1978, while Western Europe and Japan burned more, according to new figures published by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: F.B.I. FACING A SUIT IN 65 RIGHTS KILLING
description: DETROIT, July 4  Attorneys for the Michigan organization of the American Civil Liberties Union say that they will file a suit in Federal District Court in Detroit tomorrow holding that the Federal Bureau of Investigation must accept responsibility for the murder of Viola Gregg Liuzzo, the Detroit civil rights worker who was slain in Alabama in 1965.

title: Chicagoan Given 40 to 80 Years In Starvation Death of Daughters
description: CHICAGO, July 4 (AP) A 27-year-old South Side man has been sentenced to 40 to 80 years in prison for the starvation deaths of two young daughters.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Satellite Photograph

title: Hers
description: MY luggage is packed - a battered Amelia Earhart suitcase and spiffy new duffel stand by the front door. (Observe the care with which I choose my props.) On my head a straw hat, modish but restrained. In hand

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: A POETIC CITY In the summer, New York life moves to the outdoors. The streets are both wild and fabulous. Ice cream at 85 cents a cone drips down :your; fingers. Sunsoftened asphalt streets are mushy beneath each step. Neighborhood streets are full of mobiles: dance, jazz, film and theater. And swinging through these streets, youths lug the new narcotic: giant, expensive, and sometimes bass-booming AMFM stereocassette portable radios.

title: 2 Climb White House Fence
description: WASHINGTON, July 4 (Reuters).  Two persons were arrested today after Ithey climbed over the White House fence lat a demonstration supporting the legallzation of marijuana, the United States Park Police said. The two were among 4,500 to 5,000 people at a rally organized by the Yippies.

title: Crowd at Coney Island Below Normal for Day
description: The Coney Island beach and amusement area opened to a belownormal crowd of Independence Day visitors yesterday. South Beach and Midland Beach on Staten Island were closed to swimming and virtually deserted because of an oil slick that washed into the area several days ago.

title: Montreal's New Balancing Act
description: They call it equilibre in French. In English, the word is balance. Either way, it's what has made this year's Montreal Expos surprisingly different from those of the past.

title: Dance: 4 Companies at Ethnic Festival
description: IN the program notes for the New York Ethnic Dance Festival 79, Tuesday night at Carnegie Hall, Mayor Koch is quoted as saying that New York is a tapestry woven of a hundred heritages.

title: Patients Evacuated in Fire
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 4 (AP)  A fire forced evacuation of patients and employees from several upper floors of hospital today. Those evacuated from the 11story Touro Infirmary included infants and patients in the Intensive care unit.

title: Big Car Renters Are Getting Gas; Others Suffering
description: The gasoline shortage has increased business for the largest rental car companies in the New York metropolitan area, but many of the smaller companies say they are hardpressed to stay open because of the difficulty of finding gas.

title: Bailly I: A Case Study in Controversy
description: More than a decade ago, when most'of the nation felt comfortable with nuclear power, the Northern Indiana Public Service Company announced plans to build its first nuclear generator, to be Called Bailly I, between the Dunes National Seashore on Lake Michigan and a Bethlehem Steel plant that now employs about 8,000 people. The site is 10 miles from the center of Gary.

title: ATOMIC ISSUE SHIFTS
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn.  For more than three decades after the United States first split the atom, the sensitive question of how it would control the spread of lowlevel radiation rested largely with scientists and other experts whose judgments were generally accepted by the public.

title: Blazes Ignited by Lightning Burn Out of Control in Arizona Forests
description: PHOENIX,July 4 (AP)  Two fires started by lightning in tinderdry national forests burned out of control for the fifth day today alter charring more than 50.000 acres.

title: Technology
description: FOR all the talk these days about new engines and synthetic fuels, the technology that may offer the best route to an energy utopia in the automotive field is not something strange and exotic, but rather one of man's most ancient arts  ceramics.

title: TERRORISTS IN SPAIN STRIKE AT TOURISM
description: MADRID, July 4  A new eruption of terrorist violence in Spain is threatening tourism, the country's most lucrative industry.

title: PRESIDENT CANCELS ADDRESS ON ENERGY; NO REASON OFFERED
description: WASHINGTON, July 4  With some speechwriters still at work, President Carter today abruptly canceled his nationwide energy address, which was scheduled for tomorrow night. The White House gave no explanation for the sudden change of plans.

title: U.S.CANADA TREATY FACES SENATE FIGHT;Domestic Fishermen Oppose Pact Setting Boundaries Off Maine - Some Senators Listen;Opposed by Booming Industry;Regulation and Quotas;Retaliatory Bars
description: BOSTON, July 4  A proposed treaty between the United States and Canada that would end the tense but peaceful 13monthold fishing war in the Gulf of Maine and pave the way for the settlement of four boundary disputes between the two countries is encountering growing opposition in the United States Senate, as some of its members lend sympathetic ears to the rejuvenated domestic fishing industry.

title: Books of The Times
description: FILM historians who approach their subject without benefit of strict theoretical guidelines are likely to wind up functioning as anthropologists, intrigued as they are by a medium that always reveals more than it means to. And as both these

title: Airlines Expected To Seek Rate Rise
description: GENEVA, July 4 (Reuters) More than 60 o' the world's major airlines are expected to seek fare increases of up to 10 percent at a meeting of the International Air Transport Association on July 17 because of rising fuel prices, an I.A.T.A. spokesman said today.

title: Sound
description: THE future is gaining on us. A while back this column was hoping out loud that by the year's end we might have digitally mastered recordings by major artists from major record companies. With the year only half gone, London Records has already shipped from England the first of such disks.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, July 4 (AP)  Black guerrillas attacked the home of the Greek Orthodox archbishop in . a suburb of Salisbury early today with a rocket and automatic weapons, but the police said no one was wounded and damage was not severe.

title: French Dealer Imprisoned For Selling Fake Paintings
description: PARIS, July 4 (Reuters)  Fernand Legros, an art dealer, was sentenced to two years imprisonment yesterdayy and fined $3,000 for selling fake paintings to a Texas millionaire.

title: Yankees. Conquer Brewers
description: The elements were there  a Reggie Jackson blast, a good performance by starter, a big save  for the secondhalf run the Yankees must make if they are going to repeat last year's finish.

title: Auto Haulers Contract For 3 Years Is Approved
description: WASHINGTON, July 4 (AP)  A new threeyear contract covering 23,000 union truck drivers who deliver new automobiles from factories to dealers has been approved, according to officials of the International Brotheltood of Teamsters.

title: Advertising
description: Philip H. Dougherty

title: Helen Van Slyke, Novelist, Dead; Was an Executive Until After 50
description: Helen Van Slyke, a successful advertising, cosmetics and fashion executive who became a bestselling writer of romantic novels after she was 50 years old, died Tuesday night in New York Hospital after a brief illness. She would have been 60 next Monday.

title: Racism Rebounds in Part of South
description: DECATUR, Ala., July 1  In the racially turbulent 1960's, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. met with black leaders in this industrial town nestled in the rolling green hills of northern Alabama and suggested a series of demonstrations.

title: VW Tells of Discussing Chrysler Engine Venture
description: WEST BERLIN, July 4  Volkswagenwerk A.G. said today that it was holding talks with the Chrysler Corporation on a cooperative venture in automobile engine production, but continued to deny reports that it was planning a takeover attempt for the troubled American auto maker.

title: Toledo Firemen Reject City Offer
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, July 4 (AP)  Firefighters joined the police today in rejecting the city's contract offer but remained on the job in compliance with a court order that ended a twoday strike.

title: Calendar of Events
description: Sag Harbor House Tour, Sag Harbor, L.I.

title: Strauss, in Cairo, Sees Some Movement Soon On Palestinian Issues
description: CAIRO, July 4  Robert S. Strauss, who will head the United States delegation at IsraeliEgyptian talks this week on Palestinian selfrule, said today that he hoped Cairo and Jerusalem would soon begin dealing with the practical, hard problems in the negotiations.

title: Growing Pains at the Venerable NA.A.C.P.
description: In a nation of 23 million blacks, Why does the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People cry out for members and support? State Senator Julian Bond of Georgia asked this rhetorical question last week at the organization's 70th Annual Convention in Louisville, Ky.

title: S.E.C. Halts Fuelteck Trade
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said Tuesday that it had suspended trading in the stock of the Fuelteck Corporation after the regulatory agency received information that Fuelteck's stockoffering circular might contain false and misleading statements.

title: Dollar Posts Declines As Pound Climbs Further
description: LONDON, July 4 (AP)  The dollar faded against major currencies today while the British pound hit another new fouryear high. Cold prices rose by more than $1 an ounce.

title: Home Beat
description: THIS is not my normal design approach, admitted Robin Drake, the industrial designer. I usually deal with more architectural or space planning problems. But Mr. Drake, above left, who works for Eisenman & Enock, a New York advertising and graphics company, was asked to do a display for Stmv/Davis Furniture. The firm introduced a new group of British wool textiles at a recent out-of-town Market. There was nothing to stack, no pieces of furniture to organize, explained Mr. Drake, but the fabrics, which are made of yarn that's dyed before it's woven, had a good texture. That's why I thought of the sheep. Mr. Drake, sketched a sheep and sent the drawings to Arts & Crafters, a three-dimensional-display house at 175 Johnson Street in Brooklyn. There, Karl Pehme made plaster molds and cast the legs and heads of the sheep in hard latex rubber. These were then assembled and painted. The sheep bodies were made of pressed paper and covered with two and a half yards of the tweed wool fabric, and each sheep was given a yoke of curly unspun yarn. Mr. Drake was pleased with the finished flock. In the beginning, I thought the animals should have been more abstract, said Mr. Drake, but Karl made them look like real sheep. I guess that's fine for my first animal venture. The sheep cost about $175 eat); the ones here are not for sale, but the telephone number of Arts & Crafters is 875-8151

title: Plight of Boat People In Indochina Is Focus Of Battery Park Rally
description: While Fourth of  July firecrackers exploded and fizzled around them at the Battery last night, 200 people seeking help for the boat people, the .refugees from Indochina, held a rally at which flickering white candles were floated out into New York Harbor on small white trues.

title: Iran Ends Link Of Rial to Dollar
description: TEHERAN, Iran, July 4 (AP) The Revolutionary Government of Iran has decided to end the unofficial link between its currency and the dollar, Mohammad All Molavi, chairman of the Iranian central bank. said tonight.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON  New Jersey officials uiged motorists to carry change if they planned to drive on the Garden State Parkway today, as toll collectors and maintenance workers on the highway continued their strike. A parkway spokesman said that motorists who had dimes and quarters ready could make better time than those needing change from the clerical and supervisory personnel manning tollbooths.

title: Kissinger, on a Tour of Mideast, Visits Jordan for 2 Days of Talks
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 4 (Reuters) Former Secretary of State Henry A. Kis. singer arrived here last night from Jeru salem for two days of talks with King Hussein and his aides.

title: Big Game on the Block
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 4 (UPI)  Sotheby's, the auctioneers, will offer 600 head of game, including giraffes and gnus, at an auction to be held on July 19 at Vereeniging, 30 miles south of Johannesburg

title: Hanoi, at Peace Talks, Pledges Troop Pullout
description: PEKING, July 5 (Reuters)  Vietnam today told China that it eventually would withdraw its troops from Cambodia and Laos, a key condition that Peking has set for any improvement in relations with Hanoi.

title: The Policy Debate: More Public Fears
description: In Oak Ridge, where the deep green foliage of the Tennessee hills hides the atomic arsenals from public view, the estimate that there will be 200 nuclear plants in this country by 1990 seems more benign. Visitors to the American Museum of Science and Energy are guided through the core of an inert reactor and assured, by a tape recording that has not been changed since Three Mile Island, that their chances of being struck by lightning are 100 times greater than death by radiation.

title: Radio
description: 8:158, WQXR. Violin Concerto in B minor, SaintSaens; Otello: Ballet Music, Verdi.

title: Jersey Outlet One of Legal Laetrile Dealers
description: LINDEN, N.J.  After a couple of weeks of uncertainty, something like normalcy has returned to Gregory Kaye's business of dispensing laetrile to people dying of cancer.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: THE back of a door in a closet or cabinet can provide a convenient place for storage with.one of the many door storage systems on the market. Several manufacturers make plasticcoated wire storage items, including baskets, grids, hooks and shelves, that can be used in many combinations.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: Homeowners Buying Larger Oil Tanks
description: EVERY day, estimates of the price of this winter's heating fuel inch upward, and predictions about availability are tagged with such ominous phrases as barring more disruptions in crudeoil supplies. Bewildered by these uncertainties, homeowners in the metropolitan area are buying extra fuelstorage tanks and fuelconservation devices in record numbers, according to oil ,dealers and industry spokesmen.

title: The Night I Danced With Anais Nin
description: MANY years ago I went to party at Ands Nin's house on 13th Street in Greenwich Village. I was very young and rather impressed by Miss Nin. Hers was my first fullscale literary party, and its smallest details still stand out in my memory.

title: Architecture: Show Of Rudolph's Work
description: PAUL RUDOLPH is clearly an architect, who communicates best with a pencil. His words have always been slow and halting, but his drawings are easy, generous and selfassured, confident expressions of a man to whom thought comes in terms of visual images, not verbal ones.

title: Begin Wins a Test in Parliament Over Leniency in Murder of Arabs
description: TEL AVIV, July 4  The Begin Government was challenged in Parliament today over the commutation of sentences against Israeli soldiers for the murder of Arabs, but it easily survived a no-confidence motion over the issue.

title: PEKING MOVES TO CUT ITS RATE OF GROWTH;Other Significant Points
description: PEKING, July 4  China is explicitly moving to slow down its rate of economic growth after its plans for modernization proved too ambitious, overheating the economy and creating a number of serious imbalances.

title: Letters
description: TO the Editor:

title: Carey Orders Restrictions Doubled On Use of Autos by State Agencies
description: Governor Carey ordered New York State agencies to cut their automobile travel an additional 5 percent yesterday to conserve gasoline. This doubled the percent reduction ordered May 15.

title: Bonsai Convention;
description: The art of growing dwarfed trees in pots, called bonsai, flourished for centuries in the Orient. Today it is growing very popular as a hobby and more than 300 amateurs from nearly 30 countries have gathered in New York this week to learn more about it.

title: Letter: On Mexican Produce
description: To the Editor:

title: More Coal Use Urged By Schmidt
description: BONN, July 4  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt, tracing the outlines of his Government's energy policy following last weeks Tokyo summit meeting, today designated full use of coal reserves and development of new coalbased energy sources as West Germany's first oilsaving priority.

title: Dr. Mary Goodwin, Pediatrician
description: Dr. Mary Stuart Hooke Goodwin, pediatrician and a specialist in childhood communication disorders, died of cancer Tuesday at the Mary Imogene Basset Hospital in Cooperstown, N.Y. She was 71 years old.

title: Market Place
description: ELECTRIC utility stocks are performing on an even keel again, after their disruption last spring by the nuclear accident at the Three Mile Island plant in Middletown, Pa., operated byGeneral Public Utilities.

title: City Building Agency Inefficient, Regan Audit of Violations Finds
description: The New York City Buildings Department is so inefficient that thousands of building violations go uncorrected, the State Comptroller charged yesterday. The Comptroller, Edward V. Regan, also charged that the number of abandoned buildings that should be demolished was increasine in slum areas.

title: The U.N. Today
description: July 5, 1979

title: 72 State Dinner Wins as Alydar Runs 3d
description: Just before the Suburban Handicap at Belmont yesterday, an admirer presented a 25foot whip to Jeffrey Fell, but the rider of Alydar left it in the tack room and took his 32inch stick instead. That was a mistake.

title: CHINA ACTS TO HALT ILLEGAL EMIGRATION
description: HONG KONG, July 4  China has begun to take tough measures to curb the heavy illegal immigration to this British colony, including the execution of people caught trying to flee a third time, according to sources close to a high provincial government official.

title: Child's Death Prompts Station Wagon Recalls
description: DETROIT,July 4 (UPI) The death of a child trapped inside the rear storage compartment of a General Motors station wagon has prompted the company to recall 476,000 cars.

title: 3 Firemen Save Dozen Trapped In Bronx Blaze
description: Fire in Tenement Believed Touched Off by a Child

title: U.S. is Chided for 1776 Fiasco
description: LONDON, July 4  In an editorial titled The Fourth of July Fiasco, The Guardian observed today that the British Empire had not been dissolved, the West might now have good deal morefoil than it has, and it gently blamed our cousins in the United States for having started the trend in 1716.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Milwaukee Brewers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 101st Street, the Bronx, 2 P.M. (Radio WINS, 2 P.M.) Mete vs. Phillies, at Philadelphia. (Radio WMCA .7:30 P.M.)

title: A Young Couple Among 4 Found In Two Slayings
description: A young married couple were shotto death yesterday in their apartment on the Upper West Side.
