description: WASHINGTON, July 30  Foreignpurchased banks in the United States have on average steadily increased consumerrelated investments and have made a higher percentage of consumer and mortgage loans than their Americanowned counterparts, according to a new Federal Reserve Board survey.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Concerto Grosso No. 4, Geminiani; Prelude in E minor, VillaLobos; 5 Harpsichord Sonatas, Cimarosa.

title: Takeover. Moves Pace Market As Stocks Show Token Gains
description: Takeover developments produced large price changes in several stocks yesterday as the general market showed token gains.

title: Resorts Files Offering
description: Resorts international Inc. said it had filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering the proposed public offering of 60,000 units of WO million principal amount of subordinated debentures due 1999 and warrants to purchase Class A common shares.

title: Television
description: 5:55(4)Natural Resources Notebook

title: Inbred Mice: At the Heart Of Science
description: BAR HARBOR, ME. LAST Wednesday afternoon as Anna Stanley went about her chores at the Jackson Laboratory here  cleaning the mouse cages,, replenishing the food and water  she spotted a deformed baby mouse in a 5dayold litter of laboratory mice. The tiny creature had been born with no hind legs and a deformed front leg.

title: Oklahoma Seeks Confessed Killer In Closet Slaying
description: Investigators are headed for Poughkeepsie, N.Y., to look into the assertions of a 50yearold former convict who turned himself in last Friday and (Confessed to having killed his elderly wife and 19 other persons throughout the country since his release from a New Jersey prison just over a year aao.

title: Jules Irving, Director of Lincoln Center Theater, Dead
description: Jules Irving, the former artistic director of the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center, died of a heart attack Saturday while vacationing in Reno. The Bronx. born Mr. Irving, who had worked in Hollywood in recent years, was 54 years old.

title: Research Attempts To Fight Senility
description: AN epidemic that will destroy the minds and shorten the lives of millions of Americans is inevitable in the next several decades, experts say, unless science can find a way to forestall it.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WELL IN HAND One bright, cheerful place to be in Midtown the other sweltering evening was Applause (6877267), the showcase restaurant north of West 40th Street on Lexington Avenue. In operation several years now, with easy hospitality, an attractive setup that features singing waittresses and waiters, and reasonable prices, Applause's offcenter: location has turned out to be a plus, judging by the crowd and atmosphere the other late evening.

title: 5 Die in Swiss Alpine Mishaps
description: BERN, July 30 (Reuters)  Five persons, including four climbers, lost their lives in Alpine accidents in Switzerland )ver the weekend, the Swiss Air Rescue Service reported today.

title: Warning Given About Chrysler
description: In a special rating comment in its Bond Survey published yesterday, Moody's Investors Service raised warning flag over Chrysler Corporation securities.

title: A Law Limiting Unrelated Persons In Housing Is Overturned in Jersey
description: TRENTON, July 30  The New Jersey Supreme Court today declared unconstitutional zoning ordinances that limit the number of unrelated persons who may share a single housing unit.

title: At Scene for Sentence On FraUcl, Man Takes His Life in Courthouse
description: A 33yearold Long Island man who had pleaded guilty to charges of falsely billing small villages across the country for services they never received fatally shot himself in the head yesterday in the State Supreme Court Building in Hauppauge, L.I.

title: Banker's Son, Kidnapped, Is Slain
description: PEABODY, Kan., July 30 (AP)  A bank president's 25yearold son was found dead on a dirt road north of here tonight, a day after he was abducted from his home.

title: Kuwait Raises Prices on Gas
description: KUWAIT, July 30 (UPI)  The Kuwaiti Oil Ministry announced today price increases on butane and propane gas exports ranging from 24 to 41 percent a metric ton.

title: Spanish Terrorists Threaten New Bombings.
description: MADRID, July 30  A branch of the Basque separatist organization E.T.A. warned today that it had planted bombs in all the tourist zones of Spain and that they would be exploded one by one if its demand for the transfer of political prisoners was not met.

title: Porporino, About Castrati, At the Aix Opera Festival
description: AIXENPROVENCE, France, July 30  The Aix Festival, France's oldest and most prominent opera festival, foundered badly in the early 70's, but it has been revivified in the last five years with a flamboyant and innovative boxoffice mixture. These qualities were clearly on display at the world premiere this season of a curious concoction, Porporino, the story of two superstar cast rati.

title: Syntex Arthritis Drug
description: The Syntex Corporation said that the Food and Drug Administration had accepted the company's scientific data demonstrating the safety of its antiarthritis drug, Naprosyn, and had abandoned all proceedings to remove the drug from the market.

title: Iran Limits Payments Due Foreign Investors; Currency Revision Set
description: This is the last report filed from Iran by Mr. Ibrahim, who was ordered by the Iranian Government on July 22 to cease reporting and leave the country. Mr. Ibrahim has since left Iran.

title: Q&A
description: Q.What causes itching in mosquito bites?

title: The Region
description: WHITE PLAINS  The man found guilty of seconddegree murder in the slaying of Linda Scott, a 28yearold country and Western singer, was sentenced yesterday to a maximum of 25 years to life on the murder charge and one year for possessing a dangerous weapon.

title: Mets Sign Taveras And Lose to Pirates
description: PITTSBURGH, July 30 A day that started on a happy note for the Mets ended with an injury to Steve Henderson and an 85 defeat by the Pittsburgh Pirates tonight.

title: Marcuse, Radical Philosopher, Dies
description: Herbert Marcuse, who was a guiding figure to many social activists of the 1960's because of his radical Marxist critique of Western capitalism, died Sunday night in Starnberg, West Germany, after suffering a stroke. He was 81 years old.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION
description: SALLY L. SMITH has dedicated her book, No Easy Answers: Teaching the Learning Dis, abled Child, to her son Gary, who has been my finest teacher and my hardest taskmaster. He who did not read until he was 13 years old, because of his severe learning disabilities, once said: Now I understand how people can read to themselves. They have to share it with their brains.

title: Couture Forecasts Shape Of Clothes to Come
description: PARIS, July 27  The twotone suit of Yves Saint Laurent, with its slimming side panels of dark velvet, will probably be the most copied style from the current batch of fall and winter couture shows. The couture, which prides itself on being a laboratory of fashion for the world, will be pleased about that. It shows it still has clout.

title: In Voyager's Wake, A Trail of Riddles
description: THE Voyager 2 spacecraft is now 22 days and 11,195,000 miles past its close encounter with Jupiter, on its way to Saturn but leaving behind a wealth of data and striking photographs that are to scientists the raw material of discovery  and the source of considerable puzzlement. For each discovery, it seems, raises as many questions as it provides answers.

title: Peking Says It Sent 300,000 Mew To Aid Hanoi in War With U.S.
description: PEKING, July 30 (AP)  Chinese officials said today that Peking sent 300,000 soldiers to Vietnam, including antiaircraft crews, to help the Hanoi regime in its war against the United States. More than 1.000 were killed. they said.

title: Beaths
description: BUCHMANEsther Beloved wife of Meyer, devoted mother of Stamm R., Joseph H., and Rita Wolfensohn, dear sister of Molly Hecht, loving grandmother Services Tuesday, 10AM, Nieberg's Midwood Chapel, 1625 Coney Island Ave. (Ave M), Bklyn.

title: Production Index Sags For Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (Reuters) Productivity in the United States, a key factor in the inflation rate, suffered its sharpest drop in more than five years during the second quarter of 1979, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Tax Break Sought in Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (AP)  The 91 Republican members of the Senate introduced a bill today that would allow a couple a total tax exemption of up to $1,000 a year on dividends and savingsaccount interest.

title: Market Place
description: THE gasoline shortage has. eopardized the reveruni.base of the New Jersey Turnpike Alithotity, iticl Without a Change in the road's toll structure:. the:authority could be hardpressed; to pay the semiannual Interest due Jan. 1 on the taxexempt bonds.

title: Bodcaw: No Longer Just a Family Affair
description: A century ago, in the quiet town of Stamps, Ark., (population 2,500), the Buchanans and the Browns started the Bodcaw Lumber Company. Today, with vast timber and oil interests, the littleknown company is the multimilliondollar target of three major corporations.
